intro: Euphrasia alpina proles sennenii, commonly known as the Alpine Eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-green flowers that resemble small eyeballs, a feature that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous tiny flowers arranged in a spike. Euphrasia alpina proles sennenii is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye-health benefits.
